properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Temperatures reaching 31 degrees Celsius combined with overnight lows near 21 degrees Celsius are expected for the next 2 days. Hot and humid weather returns to Southwestern Ontario. A hot and humid air mass from the Southern United States will move into the region today and continue into Wednesday. Afternoon temperatures are expected to be in the low thirties both days. Minimum temperatures in the low twenties tonight will provide little relief from the heat. Humidex values in the upper thirties to near 40 are likely for both days. A cold front sliding down from the north will bring this heat event to an end Wednesday night. ### The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-11T07:59:14-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-10T16:25:14-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3501537448.2019
Area: Chatham-Kent - Rondeau Park, Windsor - Leamington - Essex County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Clear skies, light winds and near zero degree temperatures will help frost to develop tonight over the region. Temperatures are expected to rebound during the day on Wednesday. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-11T13:29:57-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-10T21:30:57-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4217634505.2019

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Clear skies overnight will allow frost to develop. Temperatures are expected to rebound during the day on Tuesday. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-10T21:59:56-00:00

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Near zero visibility in fog is expected or occurring. Dense fog has formed over the region and is expected to persist until early this evening. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
